question: Three people are entering the Emergency Room. You're the only one on call. Who needs your help first?

answers.choice: img/tumorbaby.jpg
answers.message: Two folks came in with their three month old baby boy. He has this big blob on the side of his head.

answers.choice: img/dropvrouw3.jpg
answers.message: So this woman, who has what, a few years to go, deserves your attention first? Well, alright, it's your choice. Let's see how you could help her.

answers.choice: img/kameleonkind.jpg
answers.message: Option currently unavailable

tip: Just click an image, it's not that hard now, is it?

question: Looks like the old lady has some swollen ankles, and an irregular heartbeat. She also complains of being tired.

answers.choice: Make an echo of the swollen ankles
answers.message: After six hours you find some botox in those fat ankles. The old lady's husband tells you he has an ankle fetish.

answers.choice: Send the whining lady home, there's nothing wrong with her
answers.message: Seriously? Why did you think that was a good idea? Now the woman is filing a complaint against you, and you are most likely going to lose your job. Well done. Really.

answers.choice: Test if she has a heart attack
answers.message: Old lady does not have a heart attack, although the signs look very much like it. However she has a dangerously high blood pressure.

answers.choice: Draw some blood
answers.message: Old lady does not have a heart attack, although the signs look very much like it. However she has a dangerously high blood pressure.

tip: Just choose something, it's not that hard now, is it?

question: So if it isn't a heart attack, what is it?

answers.choice: Admit old lady to have her tested more thoroughly and take a break, you've earned some rest, right?
answers.message: Whoa! The kid with the chameleon has collapsed! Your boss is FREAKING MAD. Go take care of that child immediately.

answers.choice: Admit old lady to have her tested more thoroughly, and go to the kid with the chameleon
answers.message: Moving on to the kid with his chameleon. Can't believe someone let that animal in.

answers.choice: Admit old lady to have her tested more thoroughly, and go find out what's going on with the baby
answers.message: Moving on to the baby.

tip: Just choose something, it's not that hard now, is it?

question: 5: From here on starts the baby with swollen head/neck story. It's not completely written yet.

answers.choice: Go back to start, this option will be removed after development
answers.message: Yes. Let's try again.

answers.choice: Examine the baby
answers.message: Alright, seems like a good choice, let's just see what's going on. Except for the obvious head trauma.

answers.choice: Ignore the bump, it'll go away in time
answers.message: Do you even have a heart? Go play Habbo Hotel or something Just...Go.

tip: Uhm, you can also do nothing and let him die...

question: Choosing not to examine the baby resulted in his death.

answers.choice: Start over
answers.message: Back to the start

question: 8: What to do with tumorbaby? Choose wisely and use the help function if you get scared.

answers.choice: Risky operation with a 25% chance of complete recovery
answers.message: You prepared the baby, had the parents sign consent forms and now you're taking the baby up to the OR.

answers.choice: Chemotherapy with an 80% chance tumorbaby will live at least a year longer
answers.message: You start the baby on chemo right away and hope he's strong enough for this.

answers.choice: There's nothing really we can do. Actually the best thing would be to have tumorbaby live the remaining life he has left. Move on to the kid with the chameleon.
answers.message: Moving on to chameleonkid.

answers.choice: There's nothing really we can do. Actually the best thing would be to have tumorbaby live the remaining life he has left. Move on to the old lady.
answers.message: Moving on to the old lady.

tip: Hmm, a brain tumor .. surgery is risky but not impossible. A brain tumor is usually treated by chemotherapy. The chance of a complete recovery is 25% by surgery

question: 9: During the operation you are being paged by the ER. The chameleon kid has collapsed.

answers.choice: You can't leave the baby open on the table. Keep operating.
Call another surgeon to take over surgery and rush to the ER
answers.message: There's no way you can wait until the other surgeon is here, luckily the baby is stable so you hurry to the ER.
